title: Noam Chomsky on Money and Politics with Mike Connolly
description:
M.I.T. Professor Noam Chomsky talks with Mike Connolly about the issue of money in politics.  Chomsky compares our "No Money" campaign to the start of great social movements, and he makes a contribution (in the amount of $0.00) to the campaign.


Noam Chomsky is an American linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, logician, historian, political critic, and activist.  According to the New York Times, "Noam Chomsky is arguably the most important intellectual alive."


Mike Connolly is the "Progressive Independent" candidate for State Representative in the 26th Middlesex District of Cambridge and Somerville.  He lives in Cambridge with his fiancee Kacy and their two cats, Bear and Oona. Visit www.NoMoneyConnolly.org to learn more.
